channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: I tested 11 pairs of open earbuds in 2025: these are the only 5 you should look for on Black Friday
item.description: I've spent the entire year testing earbuds and headphones, 12 of which were open earbuds (and a further 22 sets were more 'traditional' headphones): here are the only 5 open earbuds I recommend this Black Friday

item.title: Meta’s SPICE framework lets AI systems teach themselves to reason
item.description: Researchers at Meta FAIR and the National University of Singapore have developed a new reinforcement learning framework for self-improving AI systems. Called Self-Play In Corpus Environments (SPICE), the framework pits two AI agents against each other, creating its own challenges and gradually improving without human supervision.While currently a proof-of-concept, this self-play mechanism could provide a basis for future AI systems that can dynamically adapt to their environments, making them more robust against the unpredictability of real-world applications.The challenge of self-improving AI...

item.title: Building your dream PC is about to take longer and cost more - shortages see some shops now limiting SSD, HDD, and RAM purchases to prevent hoarding
item.description: A worldwide shortage of memory and storage chips is driving up prices as AI demand drains supplies from consumers and PC builders.

item.title: The BattlerGC Pro is one of the best retro gaming controllers I’ve ever tested
item.description: The BattlerGC Pro is an excellent alternative to the Nintendo Switch 2 GameCube controller.

item.title: How to watch Secret Lives of Mormon Wives season 3 online from anywhere
item.description: Jessi Ngatikaura investigates whether Demi Engemann cooked up the Vanderpump Villa scandal. Here's how to watch Secret Lives of Mormon Wives season 3 online.

item.title: ColorOS 16 is rolling out to Oppo phones, here’s the 8 features to try first
item.description: Here’s when your Oppo phone will get ColorOS 16, and 8 reasons why you’ll love the update.

item.title: I saw the new Audi Concept C in the flesh – and it’s the first sports car concept that I actually want to be all-electric
item.description: With big 'I, Robot' energy, Audi's latest Concept C could well be the first truly desirable electric sports car.

item.title: Official Trailer for ‘Prehistoric Planet: Ice Age’ Promises Survival, Snow—and Giant Teeth
item.description: The third season of this Apple TV+ natural history docuseries invites viewers to experience life during one of Earth’s most dramatic climatic shifts.

item.title: 11 Freaky Sci-Fi Hive Minds From Movies and TV
item.description: Apple TV's excellent new series 'Pluribus' explores a seemingly harmonious, deeply harrowing take on the classic trope.

item.title: To end the shutdown, the Senate voted to destroy the hemp industry
item.description: Rand Paul’s bid to protect hemp farmers collapsed in a 76–24 vote, clearing the way for a shutdown deal that could devastate the $28 billion industry. Just when you thought you’d seen it all on Capitol Hill, reopening the federal government appears to have hit yet another roadblock: Hemp.

item.title: Your ultimate Black Friday deals guide – 7 perks and tips that can help save you money
item.description: Master the Black Friday deals and avoid the duds, with these 7 top tips.

item.title: Lost your iPhone? Make sure you don't make things worse by falling for this evil phishing text giving you hope
item.description: This convincing phishing scam targets iPhone users, exploiting hope after loss to steal Apple ID credentials and bypass Activation Lock.

item.title: Apple removes two gay dating apps in China after government order
item.description: China’s LGBTQ+ community and advocacy groups are under intensifying pressure from authorities. Apple said it has pulled two of China’s biggest gay dating apps, Blued and Finka, under pressure from Chinese authorities, in the latest sign of a tightening grip on the LGBTQ+ community.

item.title: Watchdog group demands OpenAI withdraw Sora 2 over deepfakes, privacy
item.description: The nonprofit Public Citizen wrote a letter to the company and CEO Sam Altman, denouncing Sora 2’s rushed release. The tech industry is moving fast and breaking things again—and this time it is humanity’s shared reality and control of our likeness before and after death—thanks to artificial intelligence image-generation platforms like OpenAI’s Sora 2....

item.title: The Nike x Hyperice Hyperboot Is $200 Off
item.description: Nike’s high-end recovery sneakers are on sale—just in time for ski season.

item.title: Publisher Defends ‘Game of Thrones’ Illustrated Edition After AI Backlash
item.description: Statements from both Random House and George R.R. Martin's blog stand up for the illustrated edition of 'A Feast for Crows,' which was accused of telltale signs of AI-generated artwork.
